sentence.Network_en: The press invade people's privacy unfairly and unjustifiably every day.
sentence.Network_cn: 新闻媒体每天都在不公正地且没有正当理由地侵犯人们的隐私。

sentence.Network_en: I don't want to invade your private life unnecessarily.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不想过多地干涉你的私生活.

sentence.Network_en: If the enemy dare to invade us, we'll deal them head - on blows .
sentence.Network_cn: 敌人胆敢进犯, 我们就给以 迎头痛击.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'attack or assault (a person'): from Latin invadere, from in- 'into' + vadere 'go'

entry.def: To invade a country means to enter it by force with an army.

example.ex: In autumn 1944 the allies invaded the Italian mainland at Anzio and Salerno...
example.tran: 1944 年秋，盟军从安齐奥与萨勒诺攻入意大利本土。

example.ex: The Romans and the Normans came to Britain as invading armies.
example.tran: 罗马人以及诺曼人通过军事入侵来到英国。

entry.def: If you say that people or animals invade a place, you mean that they enter it in large numbers, often in a way that is unpleasant or difficult to deal with.

example.ex: People invaded the streets in victory processions almost throughout the day...
example.tran: 几乎一整天,大街上都挤满了欢庆胜利的游行队伍。

example.ex: Every so often the kitchen would be invaded by ants.
example.tran: 厨房常常会遭到大批蚂蚁的进犯。

means.word_mean: 1. march aggressively into another's territory by military force for the purposes of conquest and occupation;
2. to intrude upon, infringe, encroach on, violate;
3. occupy in large numbers or live on a host;

sentences.sentence: "the Kudzu plant infests much of the South and is spreading to the North"

means.word_mean: 4. penetrate or assault, in a harmful or injurious way;

auth_sentence.content: Our Christian fundamentalism must not invade our science classes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Our Christian fundamentalism must not invade our science classes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Our Christian fundamentalism must not invade our science classes.

auth_sentence.content: Such a virus would have to invade reproductive cells.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such a virus would have to invade reproductive cells.

auth_sentence.content: There will be a price to pay if we invade.
auth_sentence.res_content: There will be a price to pay if we invade.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There will be a price to pay if we invade.

Sentence.sentence: In 1970, a national survey showed that 37 percent of the people questioned felt their privacy was being invaded.
I suspect that whatever Facebook has done so far to invade our privacy, it's only the beginning.

Both strains quickly invaded local hospitals when needle sharing and other unhealthy practices ensured the rapid spreading of the infection by bringing people into contact with contaminated body fluids.
By invading the personal space of listeners.
He had read that speakers can be more persuasive if they invade the personal space of listeners, encouraging an emotional response.

sentences.en: He ordered the army to invade at dawn.
sentences.cn: 他命令军队在拂晓入侵。

sentences.en: Thousands of tourists invaded the old town.
sentences.cn: 数以千计的游客涌入那古老的镇上。
疾病侵袭了他们的身体。

sentences.en: The king invaded our private rights.
sentences.cn: 国王侵犯了我们的权利。

jushi.english: His mind is invaded by worry and anxiety.
He ordered the army to invade the country at dawn.
jushi.chinese: 他命令军队拂晓侵入该国。

jushi.english: The motorbikes invaded the calm of the summer afternoon.
jushi.chinese: 摩托车的声响惊扰了夏日下午的宁静。
